description: Celtic: Rodgers on Bayern Munich, potential fan ban & likely Palma exit
title: Rodgers on Bayern Munich, potential fan ban & likely Palma exit
title_page: Celtic: Rodgers on Bayern Munich, potential fan ban & likely Palma exit - BBC Sport
maintext:
On the news Celtic will face Bayern Munich rather than Real Madrid in the Champions League play-off round, Rodgers joked: "We got the easier one, didn't we?"
Celtic have achieved their Champions League objective, which was to qualify from the league phase, and Rodgers says they will now "give everything" to try to beat Bayern and reach the last 16.
Rodgers says he would be "bitterly disappointed for every genuine Celtic supporter" if the club have no away fans in Germany.
The Northern Irishman insists fan behaviour surrounding pyrotechnics has to change, and stresses that the club cannot continue to pay fines because of it.
On the prospect of more January signings, Rodgers said: "We're hopeful of improving the squad. That is key for us." He would not be drawn on whether Kieran Tierney will join the club this month amid reports that Arsenal will keep the defender in north London until the summer.
Rodgers revealed he expects Luis Palma to leave Celtic this month to sign for an unnamed club on a loan deal with an option to buy.
